     2â†’
     3â†’useMotion is the core composable of this package.
     4â†’
     5â†’This composable imports every other composable and expose a motion instance.
     6â†’
     7â†’[useMotionProperties](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-properties) is used to make the element styling properties reactive.
     8â†’
     9â†’[useMotionTransitions](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-transitions) is used to manage transitions scheduling and execution.
    10â†’
    11â†’[useMotionVariants](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-variants) is used to handle variants and variant selection.
    12â†’
    13â†’[useMotionControls](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-controls) is used to create motion controls from variants, properties and transitions.
    14â†’
    15â†’[useMotionFeatures](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-features) is used to register lifecycle hooks bindings, visibility and events listeners.
    16â†’
    17â†’## Parameters
    18â†’
    19â†’### `target`
    20â†’
    21â†’Target must be an element ( **SVG** / **HTML**), or a reference to an element.
    22â†’
    23â†’If the target reference is updated, the current variant will be applied to the new element.
    24â†’
    25â†’### `variants`
    26â†’
    27â†’**Variants** must be an object or an object reference.
    28â†’
    29â†’Keys are variants names, values are [Variants Declarations](https://motion.vueuse.org/features/variants).
    30â†’
    31â†’### `options`
    32â†’
    33â†’Options is an object, supporting **4** parameters:
    34â†’
    35â†’1. `syncVariants` (boolean): Whether or not the variants will be synchronized on update.
    36â†’2. `lifeCycleHooks` (boolean): Whether or not the lifecycle hooks will be followed.
    37â†’3. `visibilityHooks` (boolean): Whether or not the visibility hooks will be applied.
    38â†’4. `eventListeners` (boolean): Whether or not the event listeners will be registered.
    39â†’
    40â†’You should not be pushed to use those options, as if you are not declaring the related variants, they will not be registered anyway.
    41â†’
    42â†’## Exposed
    43â†’
    44â†’### `target`
    45â†’
    46â†’Target is a reference to the element you passed as a parameter.
    47â†’
    48â†’### `variant`
    49â†’
    50â†’Variant is a string reference, from [useMotionVariants](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-variants).
    51â†’

# useMotion

useMotion is the core composable of this package.

This composable imports every other composable and expose a motion instance.

[useMotionProperties](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-properties) is used to make the element styling properties reactive.

[useMotionTransitions](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-transitions) is used to manage transitions scheduling and execution.

[useMotionVariants](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-variants) is used to handle variants and variant selection.

[useMotionControls](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-controls) is used to create motion controls from variants, properties and transitions.

[useMotionFeatures](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-features) is used to register lifecycle hooks bindings, visibility and events listeners.

## Parameters

### `target`

Target must be an element ( **SVG** / **HTML**), or a reference to an element.

If the target reference is updated, the current variant will be applied to the new element.

### `variants`

**Variants** must be an object or an object reference.

Keys are variants names, values are [Variants Declarations](https://motion.vueuse.org/features/variants).

### `options`

Options is an object, supporting **4** parameters:

1. `syncVariants` (boolean): Whether or not the variants will be synchronized on update.
2. `lifeCycleHooks` (boolean): Whether or not the lifecycle hooks will be followed.
3. `visibilityHooks` (boolean): Whether or not the visibility hooks will be applied.
4. `eventListeners` (boolean): Whether or not the event listeners will be registered.

You should not be pushed to use those options, as if you are not declaring the related variants, they will not be registered anyway.

## Exposed

### `target`

Target is a reference to the element you passed as a parameter.

### `variant`

Variant is a string reference, from [useMotionVariants](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-variants).

### `variants`

Variants is a reference to the variants you passed as a parameter.

### `state`

State is a computed reference to the current variant applied to your element.

### `...controls`

Spread object from [Motion Controls](https://motion.vueuse.org/api/use-motion-controls) exposed functions.

## Example

```ts
const target = ref<HTMLElement>()

const variants = ref<MotionVariants>({
  initial: {
    opacity: 0,
  },
  enter: {
    opacity: 1,
  },
})

const motionInstance = useMotion(target, variants)
```

file.content: # Floating UI Vue Floating UI is a small library for positioning floating elements like tooltips, popovers, and dropdowns. This document provides an overview of how to use the `@floating-ui/vue` package. ### Installation To get started, install `@floating-ui/vue` via npm: ```bash npm install @floating-ui/vue ``` ### `useFloating` The `useFloating` composable is the main entry point for using Floating UI in Vue. It takes a reference to the floating element and a reference to the reference element, and it returns a set of reactive refs that you can use to position the floating element. ```vue ``` ### Placement You can control the placement of the floating element by passing a `placement` option to the `useFloating` composable. The available placements are: * `top` * `top-start` * `top-end` * `right` * `right-start` * `right-end` * `bottom` * `bottom-start` * `bottom-end` * `left` * `left-start` * `left-end` ```vue ``` ### Middleware Middleware allows you to extend the functionality of Floating UI. The most common middleware are: * **`offset`**: Adds a gap between the reference and floating elements. * **`flip`**: Flips the floating element to the opposite side if it's about to overflow. * **`shift`**: Shifts the floating element to prevent it from overflowing. * **`arrow`**: Adds an arrow to the floating element that points to the reference element. ```vue ``` ### `autoUpdate` The `autoUpdate` function automatically updates the position of the floating element when the reference element or the floating element changes size or position. ```vue ```

<template>
  <TutorialArrowInstance
    v-for="target in targetElements"
    :key="getElementKey(target)"
    :target-element="target"
    :message="message"
    :icon="icon"
    :is-showing="isShowing && !isSuspended"
    :vertical-offset="verticalOffset"
    :bounce="bounce"
    :placement="placement"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, watch, onUnmounted, nextTick, shallowRef } from 'vue';
import { useMounted, useIntervalFn, useEventListener } from '@vueuse/core';
import type { Placement } from '@floating-ui/vue';
import TutorialArrowInstance from './TutorialArrowInstance.vue';

const MODAL_EVENT = 'ui:modal-visibility';

interface Props {
  /** CSS selector for the target element(s) to point to */
  targetSelector: string;
  /** Message to display in the tutorial */
  message: string;
  /** Icon to show alongside the message */
  icon?: string;
  /** Whether to show the tutorial arrow */
  modelValue: boolean;
  /** Auto-hide duration in milliseconds (0 = don't auto-hide) */
  autoHideDuration?: number;
  /** Vertical offset from target element in pixels */
  verticalOffset?: number;
  /** Whether to show bounce animation */
  bounce?: boolean;
  /** Placement of arrow relative to target */
  placement?: Placement;
}

const props = withDefaults(defineProps<Props>(), {
  icon: 'mdi:hand-pointing-up',
  autoHideDuration: 5000,
  verticalOffset: 40,
  bounce: true,
  placement: 'bottom'
});

const emit = defineEmits<{
  'update:modelValue': [value: boolean];
  'hidden': [];
}>();

const mounted = useMounted();
const isShowing = ref(false);
const targetElements = shallowRef<HTMLElement[]>([]);
const autoHideTimer = ref<number | null>(null);
const isSuspended = ref(false);
let wasShowingBeforeSuspend = false;

// WeakMap for stable element keys
const elementKeyMap = new WeakMap<HTMLElement, string>();
let keyCounter = 0;

/**
 * Get stable key for an element
 */
const getElementKey = (el: HTMLElement): string => {
  if (!elementKeyMap.has(el)) {
    elementKeyMap.set(el, `arrow-${++keyCounter}`);
  }
  return elementKeyMap.get(el)!;
};

/**
 * Find all matching target elements
 */
const findTargets = (): HTMLElement[] => {
  if (!mounted.value) return [];

  const elements = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll(props.targetSelector)) as HTMLElement[];

  if (elements.length > 0) {
    console.log(`[TutorialArrow] âœ… Found ${elements.length} target element(s)`);
  }

  return elements;
};

/**
 * Update target elements
 */
const updateTargets = async () => {
  await nextTick();
  const newTargets = findTargets();

  if (newTargets.length > 0 && props.modelValue) {
    targetElements.value = newTargets;
    await nextTick();
    isShowing.value = true;
    startAutoHideTimer();
  }
};

/**
 * Poll for target elements (when active and targets not found)
 */
const { pause: pausePolling, resume: resumePolling } = useIntervalFn(() => {
  if (props.modelValue && targetElements.value.length === 0) {
    updateTargets();
  }
}, 100, { immediate: false });

/**
 * Start auto-hide timer
 */
const startAutoHideTimer = () => {
  clearAutoHideTimer();
  if (props.autoHideDuration > 0) {
    autoHideTimer.value = window.setTimeout(() => {
      hide();
    }, props.autoHideDuration);
  }
};

/**
 * Clear auto-hide timer
 */
const clearAutoHideTimer = () => {
  if (autoHideTimer.value !== null) {
    clearTimeout(autoHideTimer.value);
    autoHideTimer.value = null;
  }
};

/**
 * Hide the tutorial arrows
 */
const hide = () => {
  console.log('[TutorialArrow] Hiding tutorial arrows');
  isShowing.value = false;
  emit('update:modelValue', false);
  emit('hidden');
  clearAutoHideTimer();
};

// Watch for modelValue changes
watch(() => props.modelValue, async (newValue) => {
  console.log('[TutorialArrow] modelValue changed to:', newValue);

  if (newValue && mounted.value) {
    console.log('[TutorialArrow] Attempting to show tutorial...');
    await updateTargets();

    if (targetElements.value.length === 0) {
      console.log('[TutorialArrow] â³ Targets not found, starting polling...');
      resumePolling();
    }
  } else if (!newValue) {
    console.log('[TutorialArrow] Hiding tutorial');
    pausePolling();
    isShowing.value = false;
    clearAutoHideTimer();
    // Keep targetElements for efficient re-showing
  }
}, { immediate: true });

// Watch for target selector changes
watch(() => props.targetSelector, async () => {
  console.log('[TutorialArrow] Target selector changed:', props.targetSelector);
  if (props.modelValue) {
    targetElements.value = [];
    await updateTargets();
  }
});

// Listen for modal visibility events to suspend/resume arrows (client-side only)
if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
  useEventListener(window, MODAL_EVENT, (event: Event) => {
    const customEvent = event as CustomEvent<{ isOpen: boolean }>;

    if (customEvent.detail.isOpen) {
      // Modal opened - suspend arrows
      console.log('[TutorialArrow] Modal opened, suspending arrows', {
        modelValue: props.modelValue,
        isShowing: isShowing.value
      });

      // Track if tutorial was active (modelValue), not just if arrows were visible (isShowing)
      // Arrows might be hidden by IntersectionObserver even when tutorial is active
      if (props.modelValue) {
        wasShowingBeforeSuspend = true;
        clearAutoHideTimer();
        if (isShowing.value) {
          isShowing.value = false;
        }
        console.log('[TutorialArrow] Set wasShowingBeforeSuspend = true');
      }
      isSuspended.value = true;
    } else {
      // Modal closed - resume arrows
      console.log('[TutorialArrow] Modal closed, resuming arrows', {
        wasShowingBeforeSuspend,
        modelValue: props.modelValue,
        isSuspended: isSuspended.value
      });

      isSuspended.value = false;
      if (wasShowingBeforeSuspend && props.modelValue) {
        wasShowingBeforeSuspend = false;
        console.log('[TutorialArrow] Calling updateTargets to restore arrows');
        updateTargets();  // Rebind in case DOM shifted
        // Timer will be restarted in updateTargets if needed
      } else {
        console.log('[TutorialArrow] NOT restoring arrows:', {
          wasShowingBeforeSuspend,
          modelValue: props.modelValue
        });
      }
    }
  });
}

// Clean up on unmount
onUnmounted(() => {
  pausePolling();
  clearAutoHideTimer();
});

defineExpose({
  hide
});
</script>
